110F090321-d-09-30-03-EJE.Narrative: THE HUMP ASSIGNMENT WAS IN THE PROCESS OF PULLING BACK 12 NORTH, WHICH CONSISTED OF 43 TIN MILL LOADS.  THE CREW WAS INSTRUCTED TO PULL EAST IN ORDER TO CLEAR THE SWITCH FOR NORTH YARD MOVEMENT AND THE TIN MILL CREW WAS INSTRUCTED TO PULL INTO 10 NORTH AND STOP IN THE CLEAR SO THAT THE HUMP CREW COULD DOUBLE BACK TO THE 20 LOADS THAT THEY WERE BRINGING IN.  THE HUMP CREW PULLED BACK TO THE CLEARANCE POINT AND STOPPED WHILE THE TIN MILL WAS PULLING INTO 10 NORTH.  THE CARS PROCEEDED TO ROLL WESTINTO THE SIDE OF THE CUT OF CARS COMING IN FROM THE TIN MILL CAUSING DAMAGE TO NS 165554, NS 16866,NS 166127, CR 623910, EJE 7235 AND EJE 6871. A03002-d-09-29-03-WTJR.Narrative: ON SEPTEMBER 29, 2003, AT APPROXIMATELY 7:30 AM, UP RR CONTACTED WTJR AND REPORTED THAT THEY HAD DERAILED ON OUR YARD.  UPON INSPECTION BY OUR MANAGER OF OPERATIONS AND MANAGER OF TRACK AND STRUCTURE,IT WAS DETERMINED THE UP RR FAILED TO SECURE THE SWITCH AS REQUIRED BY GCOR 8.8.  THIS CAUSED THE #3 WHEEL OF LOCOMOTIVE CSX7904 TO DERAIL AS WELL AS CARS MP 72046 AND PLCX 18465.  HOWEVER, PLCX 18465 RERAILED ITSELF BEFORE THE ENGINEER COULD STOP THE CONSIST.

181304-d-09-13-03-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 394-12 WAS PICKING UP 13 CARS OFF SOUTH HOUSE TRACK AT FESSENDEN, ND ON INDUSTRY OWNED AND MAINTAINED TRACK.  TRAIN BACKED 13 CARS AND ENGINES THROUGH CROSSOVER AND COUPLED ONTO 50 CARS ON NORTHHOUSE TRACK. WHILE PULLING 63 LOADS OFF NORTH TRACK THROUGH CROSSOVER, THE 31ST CAR CRAWLED THE RAIL AND WENT ON THE GROUND.  TRAIN MOVED AHEAD APPROXIMATELY 10 CAR LENGTHS WHEN THE AIR DUMPED.  UPONINSPECTION FOUND SIX CARS HAD DERAILED.  ONE OF THE DERAILED CARS WAS LEANING AGAINST EHSX 5732 ONADJACENT POCKET TRACK.   ESTIMATED COST TO REPAIR TRACK AND TURNOUT IS $25,500.   CAUSE:  INDUSTRY OWNED AND MAINTAINED SWITCH OUT OF ADJUSTMENT.

181423-d-09-18-03-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Impairment of efficiency or judgment because of drugs or alcohol
181423-d-09-18-03-SOO.Accident Cause: Impairment of efficiency or judgment because of drugs or alcohol
181423-d-09-18-03-SOO.Narrative: EAST SIDING SWITCH AT MURRAY WAS RUN THROUGH BY 630-042.  0225 CST TRAIN 630-042 WAS PLANNED TO MEET2 TRAINS (493-17 AND 291-15) AT MURRAY SIDING ON THE PAYNESVILLE SUB.  TRAIN 493-17 WAS IN SIDING AT MURRAY AND TRAIN 291-15 WAS STOPPED EAST OF SIDING AT MP 92.  TRAIN 630-042 PROCEEDED EASTWARD ONMAIN TRACK CLEARING TRAIN 493-17.  INSTEAD OF STOPPING CLEAR OF THE EAST SIDING SWITCH,  TRAIN 630-042 CONTINUED EASTWARD, PROCEEDING PAST EAST CONTROL LOCATION DISPLAYING STOP AND CONTACTED STATIONARY TRAIN 291-15 AT MP 92.      TRAIN 630, CALLED GLENWOOD AT 2230,  DEPARTED AT 0120. CREW PROCEEDEDEAST AND WAS TO MEET TRAIN 493, WHICH WAS IN THE MURRAY SIDING, AND TRAIN 291, WHICH WAS HOLDING BACK OUT OF TOWN, UNTIL 630 ARRIVED. AS TRAIN 291 HEARD 630 APPROACHING, THEY BEGAN MOVING WEST TOWARDMURRAY, (MURRAY  EAST MP- 94.9 MURRAY WEST MP 96.5), TRAIN 291 SAID THEY CALLED TRAIN 630 VIA RADIO,AS THEIR HEADLIGHT WAS ON BRIGHT AND THEY COULD NOT SEE, THEY DID NOT RECEIVE A RESPONSE. 1274-d-09-18-03-PBR.Narrative: PBR B-40 CREW OPERATING LOCOMOTIVES PBR 7250-8625 AND PBR216 WAS DELIVERING 62 LOADS AND 5 EMPTIES TO THE NORFOLK SOUTHERN RAILROAD AT THE NS BAYVIEW YARD IN BALTIMORE.  THE PBR ENGINEER ATTEMPTED TOMAKE A BRAKE APPLICATION TO STOP THE TRAIN AS THEY APPROACHED THE NORTH END OF THE NS YARD TO ALLOWTHE CONDUCTOR TO DISMOUNT THE LOCOMOTIVE TO LINE A SWITCH.  THE TRAIN BRAKES WOULD NOT APPLY DUE TOA DEFECTIVE ANGLE COCK ON THE PBR216 LOCOMOTIVE THAT VIBRATED INTO THE CLOSED POSITION DURING THE 6.5 MILE TRIP BETWEEN THE PBR AND THE NS YARD AT BAYVIEW.  THE PBR TRAIN PROCEEDED IN A SOUTHERLY DIRECTION UNABLE TO STOP AND COLLIDED WITH A STANDING NS TRAIN THAT CONSISTED OF NS LOCOMOTIVES 8424, 6737, 6763, 6724 AND 85 CARS.  THE PROBABLE CAUSE FOR THE COLLISION WAS A DEFECTIVE ANGLE COCK ON THEPBR 216 LOCOMOTIVE.  THE ANGEL COCK IS A SIMPLE BALL COCK THAT IS NOT A LOCKING TYPE.  IT IS BELIEVED THAT THE ANGLE COCK VIBRATED CLOSED DURING THE 6.5 - MILE TRIP FOR THE PBR YARD AT SPARROWS POINTTO THE NS BAYVIEW YARD THIS WOULD COINCIDE WITH THE ENGINEER'S DESCRIPTION OF THE EVENTS PRECEDING THE COLLISION.  IN HIS STATEMENT HE SAYS THAT AFTER THE INITIAL TERMINAL AIR BRAKE TEST WAS COMPLETEDHE APPLIED THE BRAKES WHILE LEAVING "A" YARD AT SPARROWS POINT AND THE BRAKES WERE FUNCTIONING PROPERLY.  HE ALSO CLAIMS THAT HE APPLIED THE BRAKES WHILE TRAVELING THROUGH THE "WISE AVENUE" YARD, WHICH IS APPROXIMATELY 1-MILE INTO THE TRIP, AND THE BRAKES AGAIN FUNCTIONED PROPERLY.  THE SPEED L

WELDING FOREMAN CALLED THE GANG FOREMAN AND ASKED PERMISSION TO PREP SOME JOINTS THAT WERE WITHIN THE SURFACING GANG'S LIMITS.  THE WELDING FOREMAN WAS GIVEN PERMISSION TO PREP WELDS AT MP140.5 BY THE GANG FOREMAN.  LATER RADIO CONVERSATION WAS HEARD ON THE RADIO AND THE WELDING FOREMANTOOK IT FOR GRANTED THAT THE SUFRACING GANG WAS GOING TO MOVE TO IKE TO CLEAR THE SOUTHBOUND TRAIN.THE WELDERS THEN GOT IN THE HI-RAIL TRUCK AND STARTED IN THE DIRECTION OF THE GANG.  WHEN THEY CAMEAROUND THE CURVE AT MP 143.8, THEY FOUND THE TAMPER WAS STILL ON THE TRACKS.  WELDING FOREMAN TRIEDTO STOP THE HI-RAIL VEHICLE BUT DUE TO THE GREASY, WET TRACK, WAS UNABLE TO STOP, WHICH RESULTED INA COLLISION WITH THE BUGGIES OF THE UNOCCUPIED TAMPER.  TRACK FOREMAN DRIVING VEHICLE WAS DISMISSEDFROM SERVICE.  TWO OTHER TRACK FOREMAN WERE EACH ASSESSED A 30 DAY SUSPENSION.
